attributes.comment:
The increased fee schedule creates a discriminatory bias against interracial families
adopting from foreign countries. In my case, I have already submitted paperwork to
China to adopt a second daughter (we adopted my first daughter three years ago).
Because of the wait times currently associated with the China program, and the
expiration dates of the paperwork required by the U.S government, it is highly likely that
all adoptive parents will be subjected to a re-submission of fingerprint clearance AND
the I600A form, requiring an additional $830 ($670 for a new I600A + 2 more
fingerprint sets @ $80 each). Because these fees apply only to adoptive parents for
foreign countries, and because China in particular currently has waiting times in
excess of U.S. government expiration periods for these documents, it effectively
implements race-based and financial-state-based discrimination. An additional $830,
on top of the existing U.S. government processing fees for foreign adoption, is an
excessive financial burden, on top of an already expensive process.

Please consider avoiding the unintended discrimination by extending the expiration date
for existing and future submissions for foreign adoption, or waiving this secondary set
of fees for re-processing papers which have already been processed and cleared by
the government.

An adoptive and prospective adoptive parent,
Brian Lucas
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Brian Lucas
